text.text: How do I configure a payer with an international address?

text: To configure a payer with an international address, go to the Payer page > Addresses tab. The address type on this tab defaults to domestic. To select international, click the "International address" radio button. A message will display that requires you to acknowledge that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international addresses. The screen will change to display four free-form fields in which you can enter the address.

text.text: What is the default address type when configuring a payer's address?

text: The default address type when configuring a payer's address is domestic. To select international, click the "International address" radio button. A message will display that requires you to acknowledge that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international addresses.

text.text: How can I switch the address type to international when entering payer details?

text: To switch the address type to international when entering payer details, click the "International address" radio button. A message will display that requires you to acknowledge that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international addresses.

text.text: What action is required to acknowledge the limitations of clearinghouse submission for international payers?

text: To acknowledge the limitations of clearinghouse submission for international payers, click the "International address" radio button. A message will display that requires you to acknowledge that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international addresses.

text.text: What changes occur on the screen after selecting the "International address" radio button?

text: The screen changes to display four free-form fields in which you can enter the address.

text.text: How many free-form fields are available for entering an international address?

text: To switch the address type to international when entering payer details, click the "International address" radio button. A message will display that requires you to acknowledge that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international addresses. The screen changes to display four free-form fields in which you can enter the address.

text.text: Why are primary and secondary submission fields disabled for payers with international addresses?

text: When you create the benefit plan for a payer with an international address, the primary and secondary submission fields display "Manual submission" and will be disabled (grayed out). This is because payers with international addresses are not supported by a clearinghouse submission.

text.text: What is the significance of the primary and secondary submission fields displaying as "Manual submission"?

text: When the international address prints on the 1500 form, each field will display on a separate line. From this point on, queued claims for this payer will appear on the Manual Submission Queue page under the Claims menu.

text.text: Can you explain how each field of the international address appears on the 1500 form?

text: The international address will print on the 1500 form, each field will display on a separate line.

text.text: What considerations should I keep in mind when printing the international address on the 1500 form?

text: When you create the benefit plan for a payer with an international address, the primary and secondary submission fields display "Manual submission" and will be disabled (grayed out). This is because payers with international addresses are not supported by a clearinghouse submission.

text.text: Are there any specific formatting requirements for entering international addresses in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can configure a payer with an international address on the Payer page > Addresses tab. The address type on this tab defaults to domestic.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle clearinghouse submissions for payers with international addresses?

text: To ensure that you understand that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international payers, a message displays that requires you to acknowledge this information by clicking Proceed.

text.text: What alternative options are available for submitting claims for payers with international addresses?

text: When the international address prints on the 1500 form, each field will display on a separate line.

text.text: Can I edit or update an international address for a payer after it has been entered?

text: Yes, you can enable/disable or delete the address you entered. You cannot enable/disable the pre-configured addresses for this payer.

text.text: Are there any restrictions on the characters or format allowed in international addresses in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you add an address for a Medicare payer, you can manage the addresses you enter, enabling/disabling, and removing them if needed. You cannot enable/disable the pre-configured addresses for this payer.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle validation of international addresses to ensure accuracy?

text: ZOLL Billing validates the information on the claim against its billing rules and informs you of any issues that you need to address. As you import or manually enter information, and as the claim moves through various stages of processing, the system continuously validates claim information against its billing rules. To inform you of successful actions and warn you about problems or critical issues, the system provides validation banners.

text.text: Where can I find more information about the implications of using international addresses in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can configure a payer with an international address on the Payer page > Addresses tab. The address type on this tab defaults to domestic.

text.text: how can i configure a payer with international address?

text: To configure a payer with an international address, you can click the "International address" radio button. This will display four free-form fields in which you can enter the address. You will also see a message that requires you to acknowledge that a clearinghouse submission is not supported for international addresses.
